text: Here's how to set up a Discord server bot.
In this video, we'll cover a few ways
to utilize a Discord bot.
Use the clickable sections below
to skip around to the different sections.
A popular way to add a bot to Discord
is by going to MEE6.xyz.

Click the button that
says, "Add to Discord."

It will ask for permission to
access your Discord account.
Click "Authorize."

Now select the server you'd
like to create your bot in
and click "Set up MEE6."
If you want to know how to make a server,

we've linked a video in
the description below
that explains how to do it.
In the window that pops up,

make sure that the correct
server is selected,
then click "Continue."

On the next page, scroll
down and click "Authorize."
We are now at the plug-ins page,

where we can choose what kind
of bot we want to create.

Let's make a bot that welcomes
new users to the server.
Click on "Welcome."
Check the button that says,

"Send a message when a
user joins the server."

Next, select the proper
channel for the bot
from the drop-down menu.

We can either leave the
welcome message as is
or customize it.

When finished, click "Save" at
the bottom right of the page.
Let's navigate back to the plug-ins page
and make another bot.
We're going to make a moderator bot.
Click on the moderator icon,
then click "Yes" to enable it.
Scroll down to "AUTO-MODERATOR."
Here we can decide what kind of rules
we want to give our auto-moderator.

We're going to allow our
bot to censor curse words.
Navigate to the "BAD WORDS" section.
From the drop-down menu,

we can decide to automatically
delete bad messages,
warn the user, or both.
Let's choose to warn our members.

Let's now navigate back
to the plug-ins page
for one final bot.

The MEE6 platform has a
variety of dynamic abilities,

including one that will
notify our channel users
whenever we go live on Twitch.

Click on the Twitch icon at
the bottom right of the page.

When asked to enable
the plugin, click "Yes."
Now we can add a Twitch channel.

Write a message to send
to our channel members
and select the channel to add the bot to.
Finally, click "Save."

Now whenever this account
goes live on Twitch,

everyone in the Discord
channel will be notified.
